required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Glycerin Suppositories for Treatment of Feeding Intolerance in Preterm Infants
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Glycerin Suppositories for Treatment of Feeding Intolerance in Very Low Birth Weight Infants

collaborator.agency: Sulaiman Al Habib Medical Group- Arrayan Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Feeding intolerance is a common problem in preterm infants.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 3 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Days to achieve full enteral feeding

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Feeding intolerance defined as feeding withheld, discontinued, or decreased because the infant was not tolerating enteral feedings.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Necrotizing enterocolitis (NEC) defined as per Bell's staging.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of proven late onset infection
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of proven late onset infection defined as clinical signs in addition to positive blood culture beyond 72 hours of age.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of hyperbilirubinemia defined as level of bilirubin requiring treatment with phototherapy according to the bilirubin chart used in the participating unit.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At discharge from hospital, an expected average of 8 weeks

other_outcome.time_frame: At discharge from hospital, an expected average of 8 weeks
other_outcome.description: Growth parameters at discharge from hospital include: Weight (grams), Length (cm), and Head circumference (cm)

other_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 8 weeks
other_outcome.description: Defined by the International Classification of Retinopathy of Prematurity (ICORP)

other_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 8 weeks
Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 8 weeks
Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 8 weeks
other_outcome.description: For example: Rectal bleeding, Rectal Perforation, or Hematochezia

arm_group.description: Glycerin group "GG" will receive the 0.5 suppository (700 mg) twice daily for 48 hours. We will use the rounded part and discard the other part then will hold baby's buttocks for 2 minutes to ensure its delivery.

Rectal stimulation "SG" by soft cotton swab inserted to around 3 cm. The stick will press against the rectal wall in all direction for 2 minutes twice daily for 48 hours. Ky gel will be used to lubricate the stick and minimize direct friction to rectal wall.

Control group "CG" will receive routine NICU medical care without any specific intervention for the infant. The research nurse will do shame placebo twice daily by opening his diaper to blind the team for 2 minutes.

intervention.description: Glycerin group "GG" will receive the 0.5 suppository (700 mg) twice daily for 48 hours. We will use the rounded part and discard the other part then will hold baby's buttocks for 2 minutes to ensure its delivery.

Rectal stimulation "SG" by soft cotton swab inserted to around 3 cm. The stick will press against the rectal wall in all direction for 2 minutes twice daily for 48 hours. Ky gel will be used to lubricate the stick and minimize direct friction to rectal wall.

Control group "CG" will receive routine NICU medical care without any specific intervention for the infant. The research nurse will do shame placebo twice daily by opening his diaper to blind the team for 2 minutes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Preterm infants with birth weight equal or less than 1500 g
Exclusion Criteria:
- Significant congenital malformations
- Severity of illness such that death is likely in the first few days after birth
